title: Japanese Typography
content:
Does anyone know of any quite modern examples of Japanese typography/graphic design.

Books, websites, designers, I can't really find any good ones. Its really difficult to find examples of great design from other countries outside europe and america. I know there some out there.
author: cuttin shapes

comments.content:
Well, I got some books I really like;

“Japanese Graphic Design”  
“Kirei - Design from Japan”

these feature typography quite prominently.

sorry to be pain but have you got anymore details on them books i.e. where u got them, publisher, author etc

can't seem to find them thats all

thanks

[http://mks.jp.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063512/http:/mks.jp.org/ "http://mks.jp.org/") is the home of Maniackers Design, and their links page will lead you to many other useful resources.
cheers guys that really helped. thanks.

Characters:  
<cite>Japanese people loves characters. Many companies use characters as marketing tools.</cite>  
 [Penguin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063512/http:/www.jreast.co.jp/suica/) for Suica, passcard of JR East (railway company).  
 [Lismo (sciurids)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063512/http:/www.kddi.com/lismo/) for Lismo, music and video download service for AU (mobile phone company).  
 [Docomodake (mushroom)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063512/http:/docomodake.net/top.html) for Docomo (mobile phone company).  
 [Tarako Kewpie](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063512/http:/www.kewpie.co.jp/tarako/index.html) for Tarako Pasta Sauce of Kewpie (food company).

Don't forget about the historical sources from Japan.

Shodo - Calligraphy

Suibokuga or Sumi-E - Brush painting

Japanese brush work is second to none.

peace
